pr_title: Initial refactor of Kernel.java to split it into several classes

timeline.bodyText: Nit- this deTilde method here has nothing to do with command line arg passing, it's finding more use then we could move it to the Utils class?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Since it cannot be static, I don't think it should move to utils. Unless I changed the signature to take in a kernel reference. What do you think?
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Right, it is using non static members, maybe leave it as it is then
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

timeline.bodyText: Does it need to return this? it is essentially taking a kernel instance in the constructor and modifying it
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Technically sure, this is just there to keep the signature the same. I can remove it.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Nit- I would name it something that is more specific and suits better as a class name, say DeploymentConfigMerger, and if this is only intended to be used for deployments, should we move it to the deployment package?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the better name. Yes, I thought about moving it into deployment package. I can definitely move it over.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: This seems weird, we call kernel.parseArgs from KernelCommandLine and then kernel.parseArgs() calls parseArgs() method in KernelCommandLine class
timeline.author: fahadmohammed01

replies.bodyText: I would say that that isn't exactly the point, since this is just the main entrypoint, and our main needs to be starting with a Kernel.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.author: fahadmohammed01

replies.bodyText: Shagupta said the same. It can't be moved because it isn't static, unless I change it to have kernel as a parameter.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Moving all this to DeploymentConfigMerger makes a lot of sense, nice!
timeline.author: fahadmohammed01
